content:
Post automatically deleted?

Nope! The forum marked it as SPAM. I have unmarked that, but unless you want to add something that might make the posting relevant to Thunderbird I think it is off topic. It is not SPAM, but I really do not see anything related to Thunderbird in the content which is somewhat a requirement for posting in the Thunderbird forum.

Marking repeated posts about AI and SPAM is not going to change anything. Fundamentally your government is responsible for making and enforcing regulations that work. Mine in Australia appears to have generally managed that as I see perhaps 10 SPAM emails a month with Gmail and GMX accounts. I don't include Yahoo, because they were a failure with spam 25years ago anything they did would have been an improvement.

However I do not have a website sending me email that does not have enough protections against SPAM in the contact us parts of it and I suspect that is your issue, and that includes the video calls.

Does your website use some form of Capatcha to verify you have a human? This is a link to Google offering in that space rather than trying to explain something I really do not understand. There are many providers of Capatcha solutions and I have no position on what might or might not be a good product.

I did learn today however that CAPTCHA is an acronym meaning Completely Automated Public Turing test to tell Computers and Humans Apart) so I understand a little more than I did.

content:
I encourage NOT using that zip process; it is problem prone. Do it the simple, straightforward way:

Here is the link for moving a profile in Windows when installed in default location: 

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/moving-thunderbird-data-to-a-new-computer

here is the info in brief steps:

  1. ensure thunderbird is NOT running on old machine
  2. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  3. this should open windows file explorer in Appdata\roaming folder
  4. highlight the Thunderbird folder and copy to external media
  5. ensure thunderbird is installed on second computer and NOT running
  6. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  7. you should be in Appdata\roaming folder , copy&paste the exported Thunderbird folder there. This may prompt to overwrite an existing folder of same name. allow it
  8. start thunderbird and all should be there
creator: davidsk

content:
Per poter inquadrare il problema prova a fornire queste informazioni:

  1. Versione di Thunderbird
  2. Versione del sistema operativo
  3. Provider delle caselle email (Gmail, Libero, Hotmail, etc.)
  4. Tipologia di account (POP3, IMAP)
  5. Estensioni installate
  6. Messaggi di errore che vengono visualizzati durante l'utilizzo di Thunderbird
  7. Software di sicurezza eventualmente presenti (Antivirus e simili)
  8. Screenshot del problema (se utile a chiarire il contesto)
creator: @next

content:
The physical process of compacting requires that the disk has enough free space that the folder can be duplicated. In practical terms the folders contents that is undeleted is copied to a new file and the old one deleted. Then the new folder is renamed to replace the old one.

I do not recall seeing any new bugs about compacting, so I am guessing that your issue is more than likely caused by an antivirus product scanning. This can fool Thunderbird into thinking there is a disk space issue as attempts to write a new file result in a failure as the antivirus has the relevant file locked for scanning.

Looking in the physical profile folder, folk with these sorts of issue routinely have many files in their profile folder with the same name and a number appended. So I would suggest you have a look before moving onto trying to fix it.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
I have no idea why you do not have a spam folder in that view of the folder pane. It looks like the "all folders" view. Can 6you confirm that

Go to account settings and in server settings select the advanced button. toggle the show only subscribed folders and see if the spam and test folder then appear after a restart (I just like restarting Thunderbird for these sorts of issues). The change should happen without a restart, but if it does not restart Thunderbird and see if that helps.
